recipeLongIntro: Thanksgiving Mac and Cheese combines traditional techniques with modern twists, all within about 39 minutes of cooking. Enjoy crafting this dish that balances both taste and nutrition, suitable for various dietary preferences. Consider marinating overnight to deepen the flavors.
recipeSteps: Place a rack in middle of oven; preheat to 400F
Bring evaporated milk and whole milk to a bare simmer in a large saucepan over medium heat
Whisk in garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, pepper, and 1 tsp
salt

Working in batches, whisk in three fourths of the cheddar, then all of the cream cheese.  Meanwhile, bring a large pot of generously salted water to a boil (it should have a little less salt than seawater)
Cook macaroni, stirring occasionally, until very al dente, about 4 minutes
Drain in a colander.  Add macaroni to cheese sauce in pan and mix until well coated
Evenly spread out half of macaroni mixture in a 13x9" baking dish
Sprinkle half of remaining cheddar evenly over
Layer remaining macaroni mixture on top and sprinkle with remaining cheddar
Bake until all of the cheese is melted, about 10 minutes
Let cool slightly before serving.

recipeTitle: Spiral Ham in the Slow Cook
recipeLongIntro: Master the art of making Spiral Ham in the Slow Cooker with this recipe, requiring roughly 42 minutes to bring all the ingredients together. Enjoy crafting this dish that balances both taste and nutrition, suitable for various dietary preferences. Make sure to season well to enhance flavors.

recipeIngredients.product: bone-in, hickory-smoked, uncured fully cooked ham
medium parsnips, peeled and halved lengthwise
medium carrots, peeled and halved lengthwise

recipeSteps: Pour 3 cups of water into a 7-quart slow cooker
Add the ham, cut-side up, as well as the parsnips and carrots
Pour the maple syrup and apple juice over the ham, and sprinkle the brown sugar over the top
Cook on high, uncovered, for 30 to 45 minutes, then cover the slow cooker and cook on low until the ham is tender, 3 to 4 hours
Hams vary in size and tenderness, so be patient
When it's tender, the meat should come off the bone with very little resistance
Taste a small piece for tenderness.  Transfer the ham and vegetables to a deep serving platter (reserve the liquid in the pot)
Use a pair of kitchen shears or scissors to cut the slices of ham off the bone and let them fall onto the platter
Stir both kinds of mustard and the vinegar into the cooking liquid left in the slow cooker and taste for seasoning the sauce may or may not need salt
Pour the liquid over the ham and vegetables, and serve.

recipeLongIntro: Farmers Market Farro Bowls is a classic dish, traditionally taking about 45 minutes to perfect. Enjoy the blend of flavors! This dish is steeped in cultural heritage, often served during special occasions. Low and slow cooking will yield the best texture.

recipeIngredients.product: plus .25 cup grapeseed or vegetable oil, divided
medium zucchini or summer squash, halved lengthwise, cut crosswise into (.25"-thick) half-moons
thinly sliced or shredded raw vegetables (such as carrots

recipeSteps: Pour farro into a medium saucepan of boiling salted water, reduce heat, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until tender, 25-30 minutes

Drain farro and spread out on a rimmed baking sheet; let cool.  Meanwhile, using a slotted spoon, carefully lower eggs into a small saucepan of boiling water and cook 6.5 minutes for an oozy, jammy yolk or 7 minutes for a slightly firmer middle
Transfer eggs to a bowl of ice water with slotted spoon and let sit until cool enough to handle, about 2 minutes
Remove eggs from ice water; peel and slice in half lengthwise.  Pack radish slices into a pint jar
Whisk vinegar, 1 Tbsp
sugar, 1 tsp
salt, and  cup hot water in a small bowl until sugar and salt are dissolved
Pour brine over radish slices; let cool
Cover and chill at least 1 hour before using.  Cut tofu crosswise into thick slabs, then cut each slab on a diagonal to create 2 triangles
Pat dry with a clean kitchen towel
Heat 2 Tbsp
grapeseed oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high
Add tofu in a single layer, season with salt, and cook, undisturbed, until golden brown underneath, about 4 minutes
Turn over and cook until golden brown on second side, about 4 minutes
Transfer tofu to a plate; reserve skillet (no need to wipe out).  Whisk lime juice, gochujang, mayonnaise, ¼ cup grapeseed oil, 1 Tbsp
soy sauce, 1 Tbsp
sesame oil, and remaining 1 Tbsp
sugar in a small bowl
Taste; season with salt if desired.  Heat remaining 1 Tbsp
grapeseed oil in reserved skillet over medium-high
Add zucchini, season with salt, and cook, tossing just once or twice, until tender and blistered in spots, about 4 minutes
Add remaining 1 tsp
soy sauce and 1 tsp
sesame oil and toss to coat
Transfer to a plate.  To serve, divide farro among bowls
Arrange eggs, drained pickled radish, tofu, zucchini, and raw vegetables of choice on top as desired
Drizzle each bowl with a few spoonfuls of dressing to your liking.

recipeLongIntro: Open to infinite variations and requiring truly nominal effort, this creamy overnight oats recipe is the ideal make-ahead breakfast for those short on time in the morning. Use old-fashioned rolled oats for the best results. A batch can hold for four days in the refrigerator.

recipeIngredients.product: non-dairy milk (cashew, almond, soy, oat, or coconut milk)

recipeSteps: Combine oats, yogurt, flaxseeds, wheat bran, salt, and nut milk in a medium bowl, re-sealable plastic quart container, mason jar, or large measuring cup. If serving with a sweet topping, add agave syrup and stir to combine. Cover and chill overnight.
If desired, loosen mixture by stirring in a few more tablespoons of nut milk and let come to room temperature. Top as desired.

recipeLongIntro: Enjoy this hearty breakfast sandwich featuring jammy-crisp, slow-cooked onions which provide a huge blast of umami, making this a truly satisfying way to start your day.

recipeIngredients.product: medium red onion, cut in half, peeled, separated into rings

recipeSteps: Preheat oven to 350F. Toss onion, soy sauce, garlic powder, and 1 Tbsp. oil on a large rimmed baking sheet to coat. Season with salt. Bake until onion is browned and tender, 2535 minutes. Let cool 5 minutes.
Toss herbs, hot sauce, and remaining 1 Tbsp. oil in a small bowl. Season if needed.
Melt butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Add eggs; season with salt. Cook, stirring until eggs have set into creamy folds, 12 minutes.
Spread herb sauce on cut sides of muffins. Place bottom halves on a baking sheet. Top with eggs, then cheese. Bake until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes. Top with onion and close with muffin tops.

recipeLongIntro: If you are looking for variety in your breakfast, this Instant-Pot Breakfast Cobbler brings a delicious twist to your morning routine. Using an Instant Pot allows for a quick and flavorful start to the day.
recipeSteps: Place cut fruit into the stainless steel bowl of your Instant Pot. Spoon in the honey and coconut oil, sprinkle the cinnamon, secure the lid and close off the pressure valve. Press the Steam button for 10 minutes. Quick-release the pressure once the cooking cycle has completed.
Remove the lid once safe to do so and transfer the cooked fruit with a slotted spoon or skimmer into a serving bowl.

Place the coconut, pecans, and sunflower seeds into the residual liquid and press the Saut button. Cook, stirring regularly, until they are browned and toasted, about 5 minutes. Top your cooked fruit with this mixture.
Serve warm, topped with coconut whipped cream if desired.

recipeLongIntro: This breakfast casserole combines the flavors of stuffed French toast, bread pudding, and cheese blintz with a hint of Danish, making it a perfect sweet addition to any breakfast buffet. Ideal for early-day entertaining, you can prepare this dish the night before and simply bake it in the morning.

recipeIngredients.product: Sweet Potential (assumed to be a mix of fruits or syrups)

recipeSteps: Whisk eggs, half-and-half, vanilla, cinnamon, and salt in a bowl. Layer half the bread in a baking dish, pour half the egg mixture over, crumble half the cream cheese, and top with half the Sweet Potential. Repeat layers. Cover and refrigerate overnight.
Preheat oven to 350F. Combine sugar and nutmeg, sprinkle over the bake. Cover with foil and bake 40 minutes. Remove foil, bake 20 more minutes until crisp and browned. Serve warm.
